title: (x) Looking for an extra bold version of trajan - several alternatives {Stephen}
content:
Does anyone know of a Trajan Extra bold. Does this typeface exist if so can someone point me towards a link.

Thanks you
author: typevolcom

comments.content:
Bold is the heaviest weight in the [Trajan family](http://web.archive.org/web/20121231211557/http:/www.fontshop.com/fonts/downloads/creative_alliance/trajan_pro_complete_vp/). Here are inscriptional families that do have a heavier weight:

[Friz Quadrata](http://web.archive.org/web/20121231211557/http:/www.fontshop.com/fonts/singles/itc/itc_friz_quadrata_std_bold/?&sample_text=TRAJAN%E2%80%99S%20COLUMN)  
 [Pompei](http://web.archive.org/web/20121231211557/http:/www.fontshop.com/fonts/singles/monotype/pompei_std_bold/?&sample_text=TRAJAN%E2%80%99S%20COLUMN)  
 [ITC Elan](http://web.archive.org/web/20121231211557/http:/www.fontshop.com/fonts/singles/itc/itc_elan_std_black/)  
 [Waters Titling](http://web.archive.org/web/20121231211557/http:/www.fontshop.com/fonts/singles/creative_alliance/waters_titling_pro_bold_semi_condensed/?&sample_text=TRAJAN%E2%80%99S%20COLUMN)  
 [ITC Obelisk](http://web.archive.org/web/20121231211557/http:/www.fontshop.com/fonts/singles/itc/itc_obelisk_std_bold/?&sample_text=TRAJAN%E2%80%99S%20COLUMN)
